poem:
Title: "The Dawn of Business"

Broadcasters mute your skewed whispers,
as the FTSE sways on tiptoe, reaching.
German sentiment blooms like April lilies,
its fragrance carried across trading floors.

Numbers dance to a drummer unknown,
ascending from 87.9, bounding to 89.4.
The ballet of economics unfurls, a silent hymn,
under the watchful eyes of Munich's Ifo.

An unblinking symphony in business attire,
In its pulse, we find the rhythm of the day.
